content:
• Thursday, September 15, 2016
  • SCOR

    ComScore +6.4% in late trade as filing details accounting adjustments

    • ComScore (NASDAQ:SCOR) is up 6.4% now after hours, following an SEC filing where it's detailing the misstatements that caused substantial delays in financial statements this year.
    • The company's accounting probe is "substantially complete," it says. Earlier, comScore said it was setting a Friday morning conference call for a company update.
    • In the filing, the company names several statements dating back to the year ended Dec. 31, 2013, as no longer reliable. For 2013, 2014 and 2015, it's concluded that "all nonmonetary transactions during the periods identified above should be reversed and accounted for at historical cost rather than at fair value."
    • In a preliminary estimate of errors, the company says revenues of $286.9M for 2013 should be adjusted to $283.6M; and reported revenues of $329.2M for 2014 adjusted to $312.9M.
    • For the year ended Dec. 31, 2015, revenues reported at $368.8M should be adjusted to $339.9M. For the same period, expenses from operations reported at $371.5M should be adjusted to $350.7M, and loss from operations of $2.65M adjusted to a loss of $10.8M.
    • ComScore says those numbers are preliminary and it plans to file restated financials "as soon as practicable."
     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 PM
  • LOGI

    Logitech buys Saitek controller line from Mad Catz

    • Logitech (LOGI +0.8%) has acquired the Saitek line of flight and space simulation controllers from Mad Catz (MCZ -4%).
    • Logitech paid $13M in cash. It'll add the controller line to its Logitech G gaming portfolio, including its racing-game steering wheels.
    • “We’re pleased with this tuck-in acquisition of the Saitek product portfolio," says Logitech's Ujesh Desai.
    • After hours: LOGI -1%; MCZ +28.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • DB

    Deutsche Bank: No intent to settle 'anywhere near' $14B

    • Deutsche Bank (DB +1.7%) -- now 7.9% lower after hours -- confirms that the Justice Dept. has asked it to settle financial crisis residential mortgage-backed securities probes for $14B.
    • But the bank firmly responds "Deutsche Bank has no intent to settle these potential civil claims anywhere near the number cited."
    • Deutsche is expecting an outcome "similar to those of peer banks" -- some of which settled for a few billion, though Bank of America (and thus Countrywide) paid more than $16B.
    • The probe covers the bank's issuance and underwriting of RMBS, and related securitization activities, from 2005-2007.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM | 33 Comments
  • DB

    WSJ: DOJ seeking $14B in mortgage-probe settlement from Deutsche Bank

    • Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) is off 2.1% after hours on word that it's being asked to pay $14B to resolve investigations into crisis-era mortgage securities, according to The Wall Street Journal.
    • That's just a preliminary number, and the eventual payment is likely to be lower. But the size of it surprised observers expecting a lower sum, and officials at the bank said to expect resolution costs of $2B-$3B.
    • It's also not yet clear how much would be paid in cash vs. consumer relief.
    • As of June 30, Deutsche Bank held €5.5B (about $6.2B) in litigation reserves, though it said it expected to set aside more before year-end.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 42 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: SCOR +6.4%. CAR +6.2%. AINV +3.0%. EMR +2.4%. GSK +2.3%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: ORCL -3.1%. MT -2.7%. CS -2.4%. ERIC -2.2%. VALE -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • NVAX

    Novavax slides 84% as vaccine trials disappoint

    • Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX) has tanked after hours, losing 84.4% of its value, after it pointed to disappointing data from two vaccine trials.
    • Topline data from the Resolve Phase 3 trial didn't meet the efficacy objectives (primary or secondary) the company had set.
    • Data from the Phase 2 rollover trial suggested improved vaccine efficacy from a second year of dosing.
    • The after-hours move would wipe $1.8B of market value out at the drugmaker.
    • The company's holding a conference call in a few minutes, at 5 p.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 140 Comments
  • ORCL

    Oracle misses on Q1 earnings, -1% after hours

    • On a GAAP basis, Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) cloud and on-premise software business revenue ($6.8B) increased 5%, cloud SaaS and PaaS revenues ($798M) increased 77% and total cloud revenues ($969M), including IaaS, increased 59%.
    • Non-GAAP operating income of $3.4B, operating margin of 39% and net income of $2.3B. Short-term deferred revenues ($9.5B) increased 4%.
    • CEO Mark Hurd: "This year we are on track to sell more than $2 billion of SaaS and PaaS annually recurring revenue. We believe this will be the second year in a row that Oracle has sold more SaaS and PaaS than any cloud services provider. In the first quarter alone, we added more than 750 new SaaS customers including 344 new SaaS Fusion ERP customers – that's more ERP customers than Workday has sold in the history of their company."
    • Chairman and CTO Larry Ellison: "Next week at Oracle OpenWorld, we will introduce the second generation of our Infrastructure as a Service. Our Generation2 IaaS delivers twice the compute, twice the memory, four times the storage and ten times more I/O at a 20% lower price than Amazon Web Services. IaaS represents a huge new cloud opportunity for Oracle to layer on top of our rapidly growing SaaS and PaaS businesses."
    • Dividend declared of $0.15 per share to be paid on October 26 to shareholders of record at market close on October 12.
    • No NetSuite developments provided.
    • Conference call
    • Results
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean upgraded to Hold from Sell at Canaccord

    • Transocean (RIG +1.6%) is higher after Canaccord Genuity upgrades shares to Hold from Sell with a $9 price target, although the firm continues to view offshore drillers in a negative light as the industry faces acute overcapacity.
    • In the current landscape, Canaccord says RIG stands out as one of the best funded companies in the sector, with an asset base that has been adequately invested with some recent acquisitions, and a "rock solid"  balance sheet.
    • "Given our long-standing negative view on the sector, we look for opportunities in offshore drilling that are value- and sentiment-driven," the firm writes, seeing RIG's current share price as a "realistic assessment of its position."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 12 Comments
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries wins Buy rating at DA Davidson

    • Nabors Industries (NBR +3.8%) enjoys strong gains as DA Davidson initiates coverage of the stock with a Buy rating and $16 price target, as the firm believes NBR has sufficient liquidity to maintain its dividend and that any concerns over debt are overdone.
    • NBR maintains has the largest global land drilling fleet, with nearly half of its revenues coming from international activity, which the firm says tends to be more stable than North American markets as customers and drilling programs are significantly larger.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • MOMO

    Momo up 4.5% as Credit Suisse launches it, YY at Buy

    • App platforms Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) and YY (NASDAQ:YY) are likely to be the big winners of a live-video renaissance in China, Credit Suisse says, initiating coverage of both stocks at Outperform.
    • Momo, on the run today up 4.5%, got a price target of $29, implying 21% upside from today's elevated price. YY -- having less success today, down 1.5% -- got a price target of $64, implying 18.5% upside from here.
    • Momo is "the best play in mobile live streaming," CS says, noting new products should lead to resumed user growth and "meaningful" revenue upside.
    • "We like YY due to its proven track record and recurring cash flow from PC live streaming, with optionality from mobile product evolution and adequate margin of safety on valuation," the firm writes.
    • Though down today, YY shares are up 39% over the past three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: NETE +24%. NH +15%. CBR +14%. AIRG +12%. STRP +9%.
    • Losers: DRAM -14%. SQNS -12%. TWER -8%. AMBR -10%. INAP -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • TECK

    Teck Resources upgraded at Morgan Stanley as coal prices surge

    • Teck Resources (TCK +5.6%) is upgraded to Equal Weight from Underweight with an $18 price target, hiked from $7, at Morgan Stanley, which notes that met coal prices have jumped ~80% over the past month.
    • Stanley analyst Evan Kurtz calculates that every $1/ton change in met coal prices adds C$35M to TCK's annualized EBITDA, meaning that the $57/ton increase during the last two weeks alone has added C$2B and contributed $8/share to the company's value.
    • “The historical pattern suggests that TCK could generate significant cash flow in the coming quarters, which could help to alleviate many of the balance sheet concerns prevalent earlier in the year,” Kurtz comments.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 12 Comments
  • BOX

    Box viewed as 'underappreciated and misunderstood' at Drexel Hamilton

    • Analyst Brian White maintains a Buy rating and $18 target (current price $14.86), noting Box (BOX +2%) is focused on product innovation and forming strategic partnerships.
    • For an SaaS company, White sees the company's present valuation disproportionately lower than its peers.
    • He projects CY 2016 revenue of $395.9M and sees an extended runway for growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • XLE

    Stocks take off in afternoon trading

    • Modest morning gains have morphed into a full-fledged rally this afternoon, with the Dow and S&P higher by 1.15% and the Nasdaq by 1.5%. Apple's 3% advance is helping, as is a rally in energy, with the XLE up 1.75% alongside a 1% gain in oil.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 13 Comments
  • FGP

    Ferrellgas Partners downgraded at RBC Capital

    • Ferrellgas Partners (FGP -4.6%) is downgraded to Underperform from Sector Perform with a $13 price target, cut from $17, at RBC Capital, which believes that recent updates on major midstream contracts skew negative, making its previous downside case for lowering annual EBITDA by ~$60M more likely.
    • RBC says it is reducing its rating as it expect FGP to be under pressure until more clarity is forthcoming on the company's strategic midstream direction.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • MON

    Monsanto slides further below Bayer offer price as doubts persist

    • Monsanto (MON -1.9%) moves lower, slipping nearly 20% below Bayer's (OTCPK:BAYRY -1.8%) $128/share offer price, amid doubts about the limited business overlap, potentially lowballed terms and significant closure risk.
    • CLSA downgrades MON Underperform with a $110 price target, citing disappointing deal terms and a far higher regulatory risk than both management teams suggest; the firm also notes that the offer price is less than 10% higher than where the stock traded two years ago, and says the $2B breakup free is a "fraction" of what MON offered in its pursuit of Syngenta.
    • Piper Jaffray keeps its Overweight rating on MON while lifting its price target to the $128 offer price, which it says was lower than expected; the firm pins its approval conviction on the "minimal crossover" between the two companies, while admitting that MON's remarks about Bayer as the best option for shareholders raises doubt about the company's growth expectations.
    • BMO keeps his Outperform rating and lifts its target to $128, echoing that product overlaps are small and that the deal will be closely scrutinized across the globe given the practical realities of farmer wallet impact, the companies involved, and ongoing reviews of the Dow-DuPont and ChemChina-Syngenta tie-ups, adding that MON could trade sideways for weeks or even months.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 27 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: NRP +15%. AMTX +13%. MXC +8%. OSN +8%. SXC +8%.
    • Losers: UUUU -23%. SDPI -9%. PAH-OLD -7%. GBR -6%. ZEUS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • FIT

    Fitbit +8%; Mizuho Securities confident long-term

    • Analyst Betty Chen restates a Buy rating following investor meetings with Fitbit's (FIT +8.1%) CFO William Zerella.
    • She highlights favorable reviews of new products, an addressable market that benefits from both iOS and Android compatibility and projects increased digital health opportunities going forward.
    • Price target set at $20 (current price $15.96).
    • Despite Apple's just announced Watch Series 2, sentiment appears to be stabilizing positively for one of that product's major competitors.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 61 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: ZAIS +8%. LC +7%. TIPT +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • SIEGY

    Siemens CEO Kaeser sees potential upside to full-year guidance

    • Siemens (OTCPK:SIEGY +2.9%) shoots higher after CEO Joe Kaeser tells Bloomberg that the company may beat its earnings forecast for the fiscal year ending this month, while warning that political concerns could dampen the long-term outlook.
    • Siemens already has raised its financial target twice this year, most recently seeing EPS of €6.50-€6.70; analysts expect the final result to come in at the top end of the range.
    • Company guidance for the current financial year also includes “moderate” revenue growth, net of currency effects, and orders accelerating with a book-to-bill ratio “clearly” above 1, the CEO says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: AERI +52%. NETE +47%. TKAI +21%. CLBS +17%. CBR +16%. NRP +14%. LAKE +12%. AMTX +9%. CLCD +12%. APPY +11%.
    • Losers: UUUU -23%. ACST -18%. MSON -17%. OTC:BSPM -15%. UWN -15%. SQNS -10%. DRAM -10%. ATRA -9%. SRPT -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • FLNT

    IDI names new chief information officer

    • IDI (IDI -2.1%) has promoted Jeff Dell to the role of chief information officer.
    • Dell is the founder of information-security firm Activeworx. He has been VP of Information Security at IDI since joining the company last year.
    • Yesterday, the company set plans to rename itself Cogint and move its stock listing to a new ticker on Nasdaq, from the NYSE.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • NOW

    Guggenheim Securities initiates ServiceNow with $90 price target

    • Starts coverage at Buy rating.
    • Notes ServiceNow's (NOW +4.5%) largest provider position within the IT service management market, expansion in related verticals (IT operations management, customer service management, PaaS, security operations and cloud management), and a healthy addressable market.
    • Shares presently trading at $75.84.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 2 Comments

  • Consumer Goods - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: XNY +10%. NHTC +10%. STKL +6%. GT +5%.
    • Losers: JVA -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom price target cut at Nomura Securities

    • Analyst Romit Shah maintains a Buy rating while lowering his price target to $180, down from $200 (current price $172.72).
    • Shah: "We don’t disagree that expectations were high going into earnings, but after digging deeper into FQ3 results, we believe earnings were not as strong as investors perceive.”
    • Further attributes projected flat wired infrastructure growth, underwhelming management execution and slow free cash flow growth to the adjustment.
    • Broadcom (AVGO +1.8%) has been trading up throughout the morning, though is still down almost 5% from early-September levels.
    • Q3 report
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 5 Comments
  • VEON

    Telenor considers options for $4.6B stake in Malaysia's Digi

    • Norwegian telecom Telenor (OTCPK:TELNY -1.5%) is considering strategic options for its $4.6B stake in Malaysia's Digi.com, Bloomberg reports.
    • Those might include a sale of those holdings if it can't find an Asian partner for a joint venture, sources told Bloomberg.
    • Telenor holds 49% of Digi, the No. 3 mobile service operator in Malaysia with about 12.3M subscribers. Digi's revenue dropped 4% in Q2 amid heavy competition in the country, as customers' average monthly bills fell about 6%.
    • Telenor's moves to finally unload a stake in VimpelCom (VIP +5.1%) could help with plans to expand in Asia. Its current stake in Digi is down from a 61% stake it held prior to 2008.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • EGY

    Vaalco Energy again shuts-in well off Gabon

    • Vaalco Energy (EGY -5%) is lower on news that it again temporarily shut in a well on its Avouma platform off Gabon due to ongoing pump problems.
    • EGY has suffered several problems with its electrical submersible pumps in recent months, causing failures at the Avouma 2-H and South Tchibala 2-H wells, and says it is in the process of mobilizing a hydraulic workover unit to the platform to recover failed ESPs.
    • EGY also says its Gabon operations have not been affected by recent activities in the country related to last month's presidential election.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy loses appeal in $438M bond dispute

    • Chesapeake Energy's (CHK +1.6%) effort to avoid paying $438.7M to investors in a bond dispute is rejected by the U.S. Second Circuit Court of Appeals.
    • The court says the payout is justified because CHK waited too long to tell holders of CHK's 6.775% notes maturing in 2019 about its plan to redeem $1.3B of their debt six years early.
    • Bond trustee Bank of New York Mellon argued that hedge funds and other bondholders were contractually entitled to a special "make-whole" price because of an early redemption.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 66 Comments

  • Apple leads averages higher

    • Apple is market leader once again, and it's higher by another 2.75% today, helping the Nasdaq to a 1% advance, the S&P 500 up 0.7%, and the Dow ahead 0.65%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is flat at 1.70% after mixed-to-down economic data this morning, and oil is higher by $0.37 per barrel to $43.94.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 7 Comments
  • BAC

    Deutsche: For outlook on Wells Fargo, look to other bank scandals

    • Analyst Matt O'Connor checked the price action on Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) after its $4B accounting error caused a retroactive failure in the CCAR, JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) after the London whale trading loss, and M&T Bank (NYSE:MTB) after regulators found "significant weakness" in risk management.
    • He produced this chart which shows the median average selloff (both absolutely and relative to peers). Bottom line, says O'Connor: Wells' (NYSE:WFC) decline relative to the KBW Bank Index is about 50% done.
    • He maintains his Buy rating and $59 price target.
    • WFC is lower by another 2.1% today to $45.55, while the rest of the banking sector is modestly higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 35 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: AERI +56%. TKAI +25%. CLCD +13%. ARLZ-OLD +13%. LAKE +12%.
    • Losers: ACST -21%. MSON -17%. OTC:BSPM -14%. SRPT -11%. IMDZ -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • MYCC

    FrontFour Capital turns the heat on ClubCorp

    • Activist investor FrontFour Capital Group issues a letter to the board of ClubCorp Holdings (MYCC +8.7%) pressing the company to pursue strategic alternatives, including a potential sale.
    • FrontFour thinks MYCC shares are worth $27 on its view of 207 earnings potential, and could go for even more in a sale.
    • FrontFour says that other investors share its view that management has been inadequate in meeting expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 moves up as Buffett buys another 1M shares

    • Phillips 66 (PSX +1.8%) pops higher in early trading after Berkshire Hathaway discloses that it bought another 1M shares, boosting its stake in the oil refiner to 15.4%.
    • Berkshire disclosed last night that it bought more than 1.02M PSX shares during Sept. 12-14, and now owns more than 80.67M shares.
    • Buffett's company is by far PSX's largest shareholder, with the Vanguard Group a distant second with 30.5M shares, or a 5.8% stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 42 Comments
  • CBR

    Ciber +15%; bank hire rumored

    • Reports coming out of The Deal have Ciber (CBR +14.7%) moving in a sale direction following received takeover interest.
    • Shares are presently trading at a 690K volume level over a 427K average and are up 30% since last Friday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • NTWK

    NetSol Technologies +8% on positive Q4, fiscal year report

    • NetSol Technologies (NTWK +8.4%) posted Q4 revenue ($19.1M) 24% above the year-ago period and fiscal year revenue (64.6M) 26% above FY 2015.
    • License fees for the quarter increased to $4.2M over $1.4M Y/Y, maintenance fees increased to $3.8M over $3.4M Y/Y and total services revenue increased to $11M over $10.6M Y/Y. Gross profit ($10.3M) doubled and adjusted EBITDA grew to $4.1M vs. $1.9M Y/Y.
    • Forecasts FY 2017 total net revenue of $73-$75M and adjusted EBITDA of $13M-$14M.
    • CEO Najeeb Ghauri: "Our results demonstrate solid demand for our solutions and the continued execution of our growth strategy. Looking to fiscal 2017, we see meaningful opportunity to continue to grow and scale our client base, and will continue to make additional investments across our business to expand our share in all our markets."
    • Conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARLZ-OLD

    FDA OKs Aralez Pharma's Yosprala; shares up 13%

    • The FDA approves Aralez Pharmaceuticals' (ARLZ-OLD +12.8%) YOSPRALA (aspirin + omeprazole) for the secondary prevention of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events in patients at risk for aspirin-induced gastric ulcers. The company is expanding its salesforce to 110 from 25 as it prepares for the U.S. launch next month.
    • YOSPRALA is a combination of omeprazole, a proton pump inhibitor that reduces stomach acid, and a PH-sensitive enteric coated aspirin.
    • Management will host a conference call today at 11:00 am ET to discuss its plans.
    • Update: Slingshot Insights has a proposed expert interview to discuss YOSPRALA's market potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 20 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon sees Amazon shadow approach

    • Ulta Salon (ULTA -2%) is under pressure in early trading.
    • Earlier today, Goldman Sachs ran a block trade of 900K shares at $232.75. More details on the trade should be forthcoming.
    • There was also an announcement today by Amazon of a delivery test in Chicago for beauty and personal care products from a local store. The service is part of Amazon Prime and offers delivery for as short as an one-hour window.
    • Though Amazon's initiative is only a small blip at the moment, the threat of Amazon delivering beauty products at scale could enter the conversation on Ulta with the retailer previously lauded as being relatively Amazon resilient.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 3 Comments
  • PAH-OLD

    Platform Specialty Products launches $350M public offering

    • Platform Specialty Products (PAH-OLD -10.5%) opens more than 10% lower after announcing a $350M public offering of common stock.
    • PAH says it plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, including the alternative settlement of certain obligations relating to shares of series B convertible preferred stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 15 Comments
  • USB

    U.S. Bancorp investor day: Lowered expectations

    • The lender only holds these events once every three years, and CEO Richard Davis kicked things off about an hour ago.
    • Webcast and presentation slides
    • The theme in this year's presentation is lowered expectations. Three years ago, the bank's ROE target was 16-19%, but it's achieved only 14.8%. The new ROE target is 13.5%-16.5%. Three years ago, the bank's ROA target was 1.6-1.9%, but it's achieved just 1.54%. The new ROA target is 1.35-1.65%.
    • The targeted efficiency ratio three years ago was the low 50s, and 53.1% has been achieved since. That target remains the same.
    • Embedded in these new expectations are a combined four 25 basis point rate hikes in 2017 and 2018, a steepening of the yield curve beginning in 2018, and GDP growth of 2-3% by 2018.
    • USB -1.55%
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 5 Comments
  • SBLK

    Star Bulk Carriers announces pricing on offering

    • Star Bulk Carriers Corp. (NASDAQ:SBLK) announced it priced its underwritten public offering of 11.976M shares at a price of $4.30 per share.
    • The offering is expected to close on September 20.
    • The company intends to use the proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes.
    • SBLK -6.852% premarket to $4.35
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy enters forbearance agreement, gets lender waivers

    • Basic Energy Services (NYSE:BAS) +12.3% premarket after saying it obtained waivers to continue deleveraging negotiations with secured lenders and unsecured bondholders.
    • BAS says it entered into a forbearance agreement with ~81% of the holders of its 7.75% senior notes due 2019 regarding the previously announced 30-day grace period related to an $18.4M interest payment; the company says it will not make the payment.
    • BAS says it has ample liquidity to continue efficient and uninterrupted operations and expects to meet all obligations to suppliers, customers and employees.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 7 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: AERI +63%. DELT +46%. ACRX +13%. SPHS +12%. NAVB +6%.
    • Losers: UUUU -24%. SQNS -17%. SBLK -7%. ACST -6%. PAH-OLD -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • VFC

    V.F. Corp under pressure after BAML cut

    • Shares of V.F. Corp (NYSE:VFC) are lower in early trading after Bank of America Merrill Lynch downgrades the apparel stock at an Underperform rating.
    • BAML sets a price target of $54 on V.F.
    • VFC -3.26% premarket to $56.15.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • CTSH

    Goldman Sachs downgrades Cognizant Technology Solutions; -1.6% pre-market

    • Moves to Neutral rating, down from Buy, and lowers price target to $61 from $68 (current price $54.03).
    • Cites cyclical headwinds, IT service spending slowdown, financial and healthcare verticals weakness, and a stock multiple analyst James Schneider doesn't project to expand unless organic growth accelerates or other efforts to improve capital allocation policies are adopted.
    • Cognizant (NASDAQ:CTSH) is down nearly 7% on the month and around 10% over the last three.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 2 Comments
  • DKS

    Oppy says Dick's Sporting Goods set to scoop up market share

    • Oppenheimer upgrades Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS) after it factors in the implications of the Golfsmith bankruptcy on top of the demise of other sporting good chains.
    • The investment firm takes a longer view on DKS than some of its peers to say the "freed-up market share" works in its favor.
    • DKS +1.45% premarket to $59.50 vs. a 52-week trading range of $33.42 to $60.40.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM

  • Treasury yields slip after 8:30 ET data dump

    • On the positive side, there was a big jump in the Philly Fed Outlook, but a disappointing retail sales report for August is trumping that.
    • Taking out autos and gas, retail sales slipped 0.1% last month vs. expectations for a 0.3% gain. July's 0.1% decline was not revised.
    • Other numbers reported at 8:30 were steady initial jobless claims, a slight miss for Empire State Manufacturing, and lower-than-expected PPI.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is lower by 2.4 basis points to 1.675%.
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, VGLT, TLH, SBND, UBT, DLBS, TLO, LBND, VUSTX, DLBL, TYBS
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • GT

    Goodyear on the move after updating guidance and capital allocation plans

    • Goodyear Tire & Rubber  (NYSE:GT) sets financial targets ahead of its presentation today at an investor meeting.
    • The company sees $3B in annual segment operating income in 2020 and cumulative free cash flow of $4.3-$4.9B from 2017 to 2020.
    • On capital allocation, Goodyear says it will focus on growth capital expenditures, restructuring, debt repayment, and a shareholder return program of up to $4B.
    • The capital allocation plan includes a quarterly dividend hike of 43% to $0.10 per share.
    • Goodyear also reaffirms its previously announced 2016 financial targets.
    • Shares of GT are up 3.54% premarket to $31.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • ACRX

    AcelRx completes final pivotal study of ARX-04; NDA on tap for year end; shares up 23% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACRX) is up 23% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement of successful results in the last of three Phase 3 studies evaluating ARX-04 (sufentanil sublingual tablet 30 mcg) for the management of moderate-to-severe acute pain. The company plans to file a New Drug Application (NDA) with the FDA by year end.
    • The single-arm, open-label study, called SAP303, enrolled 140 patients over the age of 40 who were expected to experience moderate-to-severe pain following surgery. The primary efficacy endpoint was time-weighted summed pain intensity difference (SPID) over 12 hours. Treatment with ARX-04 reduced pain starting 30 minutes after the first dose. The mean reductions in pain intensity from baseline at one hour, two hours and 12 hours were 27%, 49% and 57%, respectively.
    • Regardless of age and organ function, ~2/3 of the participants experienced no adverse events (AEs) during the study. The most common AEs were nausea and headache.
    • ARX-04 consists of 30 mcg tablets of sufentanil (synthetic opioid five to ten times as potent as fentanyl) delivered as often as once per hour sublingually (under the tongue) via a disposable, pre-filled, single-dose applicator.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 9:00 am ET to discuss the data.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple higher premarket as Credit Suisse boosts iPhone estimates

    • Noting positive data from its team in Japan around iPhone builds, recent announcements from T-Mobile and Sprint, and the team's proprietary iPhone survey, Credit Suisse sees iPhone volumes of 215M this year and 221M in 2017 vs. 208M/217M previously. 2018 is maintained at 249M units as conversations with display suppliers support Credit Suisse's iPhone 8 super-cycle thesis.
    • 2016 EPS estimates are raised from $8.22 to $7.95, and 2017 to $10.09 from $9.84. "Given high retention rates, a superior ecosystem and a multi-product compute advantage, we believe FCF of ~$67B should be sustainable LT."
    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is maintained at Outperform with $150 price target. Shares +1%  remarket to $112.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM | 71 Comments
